holidays.name: International Mountain Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to raising awareness about the importance of mountains and promoting sustainable mountain development.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2003 to highlight the environmental, cultural, and economic significance of mountain regions worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Mountains cover about 22% of the Earth's land surface and are home to over half of all terrestrial biodiversity species!

holidays.name: National App Day (USA)
holidays.description: Celebrate the app developers and the amazing applications on your phone or computer that make life easier and more fun!
holidays.origin: An unofficial modern holiday that recognizes the massive impact of mobile and computer apps on daily life.
holidays.funFact: The first app store was launched in 2008 by Apple, revolutionizing how we download and use software.

holidays.name: National Deluxe Holiday Meal Day (USA)
holidays.description: Celebrate by enjoying a luxuriously extravagant meal with all the trimmings and maybe a little something extra!
holidays.origin: An informal food holiday encouraging indulgence in festive feasts during the holiday season.
holidays.funFact: In preparation for the holidays, Americans consume about 46 million turkeys annually ‚Äî talk about a deluxe meal!

holidays.name: Chupacabra Awareness Day
holidays.description: An unofficial day to dive into the legends and lore of the infamous Chupacabra, the mythical goat-sucking creature.
holidays.origin: Rooted in Latin American folklore, this day celebrates the mystery and entertainment surrounding this cryptid.
holidays.funFact: The Chupacabra was first reported in Puerto Rico in the 1990s and quickly became a pop culture icon for strange phenomena.
